channel.title: If 556, 51 = a certain colour
channel.description:
hey guys, im new to scripting scar, so need a little help with this, its not for runescape though, basicly i want it to press the spacebar and release it if a certain colour is at the given posistion.. the code i have so far, which doesn't work is below
[code]program New; const PerfColor= 8449704; begin If (Getcolor(556, 51)) = (PerfColor) then begin Writeln('Woo') end else Writeln('Boo') end.[/code]
I also would like it to loop untill i stop it,
Cheers for any help guys

item.title: If 556, 51 = a certain colour
item.dc:creator: @script_owned script_owned
item.description:
@script_owned wrote:

Haven’t done SCAR in a while but I think this might work:

program New;
  const
   PerfColor = 8449704;

procedure New;
 begin
   KeyDown(32);
     if(GetColor(556, 051) = PerfColor)then
       begin
         KeyUp(32);
       Writeln('Woo');
      end else
   Writeln('Boo')
end;

begin
 repeat
   New;
  until(isfkeydown(4));
end.

It stops after the loops is done when you press f4.

Read full topic

item.title: If 556, 51 = a certain colour
item.dc:creator: @FrostFyr FrostFÿr
item.description:
@FrostFyr wrote:

ok so firstly, your missing a begin and end around the bit after Else
and to check a colour you have to move the colour your compairing <- one bracket like “Getcolor(333,456)=Color”
and to repeat you’ll need to use the repeat - until function:

repeat //stuff until(Condition)
You can replace condition with whatever you want, like IsFKeyDown(9)“If F9 is pressed, stop”

your code with these hints will look something like this

program New; const PerfColor= 8449704; begin repeat If (Getcolor(556, 51)=PerfColor) then begin Writeln('Woo') end else begin Writeln('Boo') end; wait(5); until(IsFKeyDown(9)) end.

enjoy, hope you learnt something from this

Read full topic
